intro: Eritrichium macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are small, rounded, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
